source_sentence: 歸命毘盧遮那佛　　身口意業遍虛空　演說如來三密門　　金剛一乘甚深教　我依瑜伽最勝法　　開示如實修行處　為令眾生顯真實　　頓證無上正等覺　弟子堅固菩提心　　從師已受灌頂位　妙修定慧恒觀察　　深入業用善巧門　導諸有情勝菩提　　以四攝法而攝取　無厭大悲未嘗捨　　見行小善便稱美　無住檀施等虛空　　能以慧光破愚瞑　有所樂求恒不逆　　發言先笑令心喜　能於妙法無染中　　善用般若斷諸使　無上法輪恒不退　　四辯演說無所畏　諸佛眾生事業中　　恒被大誓慈甲冑　摧敗魔羅勝軍眾　　堅持諸佛所祕門　有具如斯眾德者　　方堪印可為傳授　先佛聖仙所遊處　　種種勝地或山間　建立精室布輪壇　　香泥塗拭為尊位　燈明閼伽皆布列　　妙花散地以莊嚴　為令眾生器世間　　純一淨妙為佛土　以此自他清淨句　　應理思惟密稱誦真言曰。
translation: I take refuge in the Buddha Vairocana, whose activities of body, speech, and thought pervade space, who teaches the three mysterious ways of the Tathāgata and the profound teachings of the Vajra One Vehicle. I rely on the most excellent yoga teaching to reveal the true place of practice in order to cause sentient beings to reveal the truth and suddenly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. The disciple firmly establishes the mind of enlightenment. After receiving the consecration from his teacher, he always observes the marvelous cultivation of concentration and wisdom, and deeply enters the skillful gate of karma, leading sentient beings to surpass enlightenment. He collects sentient beings with the four methods of gathering, never tiring of great compassion, never abandoning. He praises the beauty of minor good deeds when he sees them.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩(二合下同)婆嚩(二合下同)戍陀(二)薩婆達摩(三)薩嚩(二合)婆嚩戍度[牟*含](四)　次應運心遍法界　　塵剎佛海滿虛空　吽字種子加三業　　結金剛起遍警覺　檀慧鉤結金剛拳　　進力二度合三舉真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)薩嚩(二合下同)婆嚩(二合下同)戍陀(二)薩婆達摩(三)薩嚩(二合)婆嚩戍度[牟*含](四)　次應運心遍法界　　塵剎佛海滿虛空　吽字種子加三業　　結金剛起遍警覺　檀慧鉤結金剛拳　　進力二度合三舉真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折[口*路](二合下同)底瑟姹(二合)　由此真言印加持　　諸佛不貪寂靜樂　悉從定起赴集會　　觀察行人同攝受　次結金剛持大印　　一一想禮如來足　禪慧檀智反相叉　　右膝著地置頂上真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) mohajar [kou*lu] (2) tiṣerjee (2) This is the seal of the true teaching that blesses all buddhas who don't crave the quiescent bliss and all arise from meditation to go to the assembly, observing and collecting practitioners together. Next, he forms the great vajra-wielding seal, saluting the Tathāgata's feet with each thought, saluting him with his meditation and wisdom, saluting him with his right knee on the ground, and placing it on his head, the true teaching says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉(二合下同)勿(微一切)　纔結金剛持印已　　一切正覺皆隨順　即於十方諸佛前　　禮事供養皆圓滿　為欲承事諸如來　　捨身奉獻阿閦佛　全身委地以心禮　　金剛合掌舒頂上真言曰。
translation: "After he has closed the vajra-charging mudrā, all the perfectly enlightened ones follow suit. That's when he presents himself before the buddhas in the ten directions, fulfilling all his rituals and offerings. In order to serve the tathāgatas, he dedicates himself to Akṣobhya Buddha, puts his whole body on the ground, and venerates him with his heart.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆怛他(引下同)蘖多(引下同二)布儒波薩他(二合)娜野(引)阿怛麼(二合下同)南(三)涅哩(二合)夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多麼折囉薩怛嚩(二合下同五)阿地瑟姹(二合下同)薩嚩(二合下同)[牟*含]　由此真言身印故　　即得圓滿菩提心　次應敬禮寶生尊　　為奉灌頂供養故　金剛合掌下當心　　以額著地為奉獻真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)薩婆怛他(引下同)蘖多(引下同二)布儒波薩他(二合)娜野(引)阿怛麼(二合下同)南(三)涅哩(二合)夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多麼折囉薩怛嚩(二合下同五)阿地瑟姹(二合下同)薩嚩(二合下同)[牟*含]　由此真言身印故　　即得圓滿菩提心　次應敬禮寶生尊　　為奉灌頂供養故　金剛合掌下當心　　以額著地為奉獻真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆怛他蘖多(二)布惹(引)毘曬迦耶(引三)怛麼南(二合)涅哩夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多(五)麼折囉囉怛那(二合引)毘詵遮薩縛(二合)[牟*含]　由獻此身妙請故　　不久當為三界主　為求供養轉法輪　　次應敬禮無量壽　金剛合掌置頂上　　以口著地奉其身真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Sarvâstivāda (2) Pūrvajña (2) Vairocana (3) Tammānā (2) Neriyathāyamitra (4) Sarvâstivāda (5) Mātsaratana (2) Vairocana (2) [mu*ham] Because of this wonderful invitation to offer his body, he will soon become the lord of the three realms, seek offerings, and turn the wheel of the Dharma. Next, he should venerate the Vajra with his palms together on top of his head, put his mouth on the ground, and present his body, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆怛他蘖多(二)布惹鉢囉(二合下同)靺[口*栗]多那夜(引)怛麼南(三)涅哩夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多(五)麼折囉達摩(六)鉢囉靺[口*栗]多(二合)夜[牟*含]　由獻此身誠請故　　當同救世轉法輪　復當敬禮不空尊　　為求供養羯磨故　金剛合掌當心上　　用頂著地而奉獻真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Sāvatathāgata (2) Pujāpala (2) Mo[ku*ri]dāna (2) Mo[ku*ri]dāna (3) Niryāyatāyamī (4) Sāvatathāgata (5) Māṣeradharma (6) Pārāva [ku*ri]dāna (2) Mo[ku*hāna] Because of this sincere invitation to dedicate his body, he will turn the wheel of the Dharma together to save the world. Furthermore, you should venerate the Venerable Bhūtān for seeking offerings to the karma by placing his palms together over his heart, placing his mouth on the ground, and dedicating his body, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩婆怛他蘖多(二)布惹羯麼抳阿怛麼(二合)南(三)涅哩夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多(五)麼折囉羯麼抳句[口*路](二合)[牟*含]　由是獻身方便故　　便能示現種種身　次以己身佛海前　　合掌[跍*月]跪懺諸咎　無始輪迴諸有中　　身口意業所生罪　如佛菩薩所懺悔　　我今陳懺亦如是　又應深發歡喜心　　隨喜一切福智聚　諸佛菩薩行願中　　金剛三業所生福　緣覺聲聞及有情　　所集善根盡隨喜　復觀諸佛坐道樹　　己身各請轉法輪　一切世燈坐道場　　覺眼開敷照三有　我皆胡跪先勸請　　轉於無上妙法輪　又皆勸請諸世尊　　不般涅槃恒住世　所有如來三界主　　臨般無餘涅槃者　我皆勸請恒久住　　不捨悲願救世間　懺悔隨喜勸請福　　願我不失菩提心　諸佛菩薩妙眾中　　常為善支不厭捨　離於八難生無難　　宿命住智相嚴身　遠離愚迷具悲智　　悉能滿足波羅蜜　富樂豐饒生勝族　　眷屬廣多恒熾盛　四無礙辯十自在　　六通諸禪悉圓滿　如金剛幢及普賢　　願讚迴向亦如是　行者次修三摩地　　跏趺端身入正受　四無量心盡法界　　修習運用如法教　即入普賢三昧耶　　體同薩埵金剛故　定慧和合金剛縛　　忍願二度建如幢　纔誦本誓印真言　　身處月輪同薩埵真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)薩婆怛他蘖多(二)布惹羯麼抳阿怛麼(二合)南(三)涅哩夜多夜弭(四)薩婆怛他蘖多(五)麼折囉羯麼抳句[口*路](二合)[牟*含]　由是獻身方便故　　便能示現種種身　次以己身佛海前　　合掌[跍*月]跪懺諸咎　無始輪迴諸有中　　身口意業所生罪　如佛菩薩所懺悔　　我今陳懺亦如是　又應深發歡喜心　　隨喜一切福智聚　諸佛菩薩行願中　　金剛三業所生福　緣覺聲聞及有情　　所集善根盡隨喜　復觀諸佛坐道樹　　己身各請轉法輪　一切世燈坐道場　　覺眼開敷照三有　我皆胡跪先勸請　　轉於無上妙法輪　又皆勸請諸世尊　　不般涅槃恒住世　所有如來三界主　　臨般無餘涅槃者　我皆勸請恒久住　　不捨悲願救世間　懺悔隨喜勸請福　　願我不失菩提心　諸佛菩薩妙眾中　　常為善支不厭捨　離於八難生無難　　宿命住智相嚴身　遠離愚迷具悲智　　悉能滿足波羅蜜　富樂豐饒生勝族　　眷屬廣多恒熾盛　四無礙辯十自在　　六通諸禪悉圓滿　如金剛幢及普賢　　願讚迴向亦如是　行者次修三摩地　　跏趺端身入正受　四無量心盡法界　　修習運用如法教　即入普賢三昧耶　　體同薩埵金剛故　定慧和合金剛縛　　忍願二度建如幢　纔誦本誓印真言　　身處月輪同薩埵真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)三磨耶(二)薩怛梵(三合下同)　次結極喜三昧印　　以此悅樂契諸聖　忍願入於滿月掌　　禪智檀慧俱申並真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) samaya (2) satvan (3 together, same below), then he makes the samādhi-mudrā sign of ultimate bliss, which brings joy and happiness to the sages, forbearance and vows to enter the palm of the full moon, and meditation, wisdom, and understanding are both expressed in the following dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 唵(一)三磨耶斛(引二)蘇囉多薩怛梵(三合)　由此妙印及真言　　一切聖眾皆歡喜　次當開心入佛智　　怛囉吒字想乳上　掣金剛縛當心前　　二字轉樞如啟扇真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) samaya-du (2) surāta-sattvam (3 together) This is a wonderful seal and true saying that rejoices all the noble people. Next, you should open your mind and enter the Buddha's wisdom.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉滿馱(二)怛囉(二合)吒　八葉白蓮一肘開　　炳現阿字素光色　禪智俱入金剛縛　　召入如來寂靜智真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) mojaramandaka (2) tārāṣṭa, the eight-leaf white lotus opens at one elbow, reveals the color of the letter a in plain light, and enters the vajra bond with both meditation and wisdom. He summons them to enter the Tathāgata's quiescent wisdom," he said.
"Om (1) mahjarat (2) viśeṣaśas.

source_sentence: 次結如來堅固拳　　進力屈柱禪智背　以此妙印相應故　　即得堅持諸佛智真言曰。
translation: "Next, he forms the tathāgata's firm fist, bending the pillar of meditative wisdom with the power of this wonderful seal, and then he attains insight into the buddhas' wisdom, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉(二)母瑟知(二合)[牟*含]　次以威怒降三世　　淨除內外所生障　二羽交臂金剛拳　　檀慧相鉤竪進力　行者想身發威焰　　八臂四面竪利牙　震吼吽字如雷音　　頂上右旋成結界真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) mojarā (2) moserchi (2) [mu*han], next subdue the three worlds with an aura of wrath that purifies and removes the hindrances produced within and without. The two-finned, interlocking-armed vajra fist, the hooked, advancing power of donating wisdom, and the practitioner's perception of the body give rise to a blazing, eight-armed, four-faced, sharp-tongued, and shining-roar character like the sound of thunder, which is rotated to the right at the top of the head to form a boundary," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)孫(蘇甚反下同)婆儞遜婆儞吽(二)仡里(二合)釁拏仡里釁拏吽(三)仡里釁拏阿播耶吽(四)阿難耶斛(五)薄伽梵麼折囉吽發吒(六)　次結蓮花三昧耶　　為令成就三摩地　定慧二羽金剛縛　　檀慧禪智和合竪　由此真言密印故　　修行三昧速現前真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)孫(蘇甚反下同)婆儞遜婆儞吽(二)仡里(二合)釁拏仡里釁拏吽(三)仡里釁拏阿播耶吽(四)阿難耶斛(五)薄伽梵麼折囉吽發吒(六)　次結蓮花三昧耶　　為令成就三摩地　定慧二羽金剛縛　　檀慧禪智和合竪　由此真言密印故　　修行三昧速現前真言曰。

aggregates, elements, fields, and so forth.

translation: You haven't yet realized the vajra-yoga samādhi or the wisdom of sarvajña.
Don't be contented with that.
You should fulfill Samantabhadra.
You'll achieve supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 行者聞警已　　定中普禮足
translation: After the practitioner hears the warning, he'll bow his feet together in meditation.

source_sentence: 唯願諸如來　　示我所行處
translation: May the tathāgatas show me where to practice

source_sentence: 諸佛同音言　　汝應觀自心
translation: The buddhas spoke with one voice, saying, "You should examine your own mind.

source_sentence: 既聞是說已　　如教觀自心
translation: Having heard this teaching, you have observed your own mind as you were taught.

source_sentence: 久住諦觀察　　不見自心相
translation: observes with long-abiding sincerity and does not see the marks of one's own mind

source_sentence: 復想禮佛足　　白言最勝尊
translation: "Again, I would like to bow at the Buddha's feet and say, 'Most honored One!'

source_sentence: 我不見自心　　此心為何相
translation: "I don't see my own mind. What are the characteristics of this mind?

source_sentence: 諸佛咸告言　　心相難測量
translation: The buddhas all say, "The characteristics of the mind are difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 授與心真言　　如理諦觀心
translation: True Words of Giving the Mind Observing the Mind According to Reason

source_sentence: 唵(一)質多鉢囉(二合)底(二)微鄧迦嚕彌(三)　念頃便見心　　圓滿如淨月　復作是思惟　　是心為何物　煩惱習種子　　善惡皆由心　心為阿賴耶　　修淨以為因　六度熏習故　　彼心為大心　藏識本非染　　清淨無瑕穢　長時積福智　　喻若淨滿月　無體亦無事　　即說亦非月　由具福智故　　自心如滿月　踊躍心歡喜　　復白諸世尊　我已見自心　　清淨如滿月　離諸煩惱垢　　能執所執等　諸佛皆告言　　汝心本如是　為客塵所翳　　菩提心為淨　汝觀淨月輪　　得證菩提心　授此心真言　　密誦而觀照唵(一)菩提質多(二)母怛跛(二合)娜夜彌　能令心月輪　　圓滿益明顯　諸佛復告言　　菩提為堅固　善住堅固故　　復授心真言唵(一)底瑟姹(二合)麼折囉(二)　汝於淨月輪　　觀五智金剛　令普周法界　　唯一大金剛　應當知自身　　即為金剛界唵(一)麼折囉(引)怛麼句含(二)　自身為金剛　　堅實無傾壞　復白諸佛言　　我為金剛身　時彼諸如來　　便勅行者言　觀身為佛形　　復授此真言唵(一)曳他(二)薩婆怛他蘖多(三)薩怛他含　以證心清淨　　自見身為佛　眾相皆圓備　　即證薩婆若　定中遍禮佛　　願加持堅固　一切諸佛聞　　金剛界言已　盡入金剛中　　便說金剛心唵(一)薩婆怛他蘖多(引)(二)鼻三菩提(三)涅里荼(四)麼折囉底瑟姹(二合)　諸佛大名稱　　纔說是明已　等覺金剛界　　便證真實智　時彼諸如來　　加持堅固已　還從金剛出　　普住於虛空　行者作是念　　已證金剛定　便具薩婆若　　我成正等覺　為令證入佛地故　　當結金剛三昧耶　十度圓滿外相叉　　忍願如幢皆正直　印心及額喉與頂　　各誦一遍以加持真言曰。
translation: Om (1) Cūḍapanthaka (2) Maitreya (2) Vetangkaruṇī (3) After a moment of thought, he then sees his mind as complete as the pure moon. Again, he thinks, "What is this mind? What is this mind? The seeds of afflictive habits? Good and evil all originate in the mind? The mind is the store consciousness that is originally not defiled, pure and undefiled, and because of the perfuming of the six perfections, his mind is a great mind. He has accumulated over a long period of time meritorious wisdom. He is likened to a pure full moon that has neither body nor matter, which is also not a moon.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉薩怛嚩(引)(二)地瑟姹(二合)薩嚩(二合)[牟*含]　即想虛空諸如來　　持虛空寶灌我頂　定慧和合金剛縛　　進力禪智如寶形　以印額上加持已　　五佛智冠在其頂　便分智拳頂後繞　　當知已繫離垢繒真言曰。
translation: "After applying the seal on his forehead and upholding it, he places the crown of the five buddha-wisdoms on his head and wraps his fist around the top of his head in wisdom. He then knows that he has bound himself to the seclusion silks," he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉囉旦娜(二合)(二)阿避詵者[牟*含](三)薩婆畝捺囉(二合)迷(四)涅里(二合)值句嚧(五)嚩囉迦縛制(六)那[牟*含]行者復應作是思惟。
translation: "Om (1) Māṣerādana (2) (2) Aśvajit [mu*hāra] (3) Sāvajit [mu*hāra] (2) Māmu [mu*hāra] (4) Neri (2) Jargon [mu*hāra] (5) Vārāḍika [mu*hāra] (6) Again, the practitioner should think like this.
'Now, I've become perfectly enlightened.
I will become completely enlightened.
I'll arouse great compassion.
Throughout endless birth and death.
I'll always be adorned with the armor of a great vow.
That's because I want to purify the Buddha's land.
Accomplish the success of sentient beings.
They will serve all tathāgatas and so forth.
They all cause all sentient beings to...
They'll sit on the bodhi tree.
They subdue celestials and Māra.

source_sentence: 成最正覺故應被三世如來慈悲甲冑。
translation: Because they've become most truly enlightened, they should be armored by the compassionate armor of the tathāgatas of the three times.

source_sentence: 智拳繫鬘頂後已　　便復前垂舒進力　唵砧二度相縈遶　　不絕綠光如繫甲　心背臍腰兩膝上　　喉頂額前及頸後　悉以進力三旋繞　　散掌前下垂天衣　即能普護諸眾生　　一切天魔不能壞真言曰。
translation: After he binds the fist of wisdom to the top of his head, he then goes forward and drapes it with the power of effort, and the two anvils wrap around it in a circular motion that doesn't cut off the green light like a binder's armor. He backs his heart, navel, waist, knees, top of his throat, forehead, and the back of his neck, and he wraps it three times with the power of effort, scattering his palms and lowering his celestial robes.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉迦嚩制(二)麼折[口*(肄-聿+(企-止+木))](二合)句嚧(三)麼折囉麼折囉含(四)　次應結彼歡喜印　　定慧二羽三相拍　由以指印加持故　　一切聖眾皆歡喜真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)麼折囉迦嚩制(二)麼折[口*(肄-聿+(企-止+木))](二合)句嚧(三)麼折囉麼折囉含(四)　次應結彼歡喜印　　定慧二羽三相拍　由以指印加持故　　一切聖眾皆歡喜真言曰。
"Om(1) mojarāta-mātṛkā-dundubhi(2).

source_sentence: 行者次應以成所作智三摩地。
translation: Next, practitioners should use the samādhi of knowledge of what's accomplished.
He should contemplate himself in front of his body.
He should contemplate the inexhaustible ocean of milk.
From it rises the great lotus flower king.
The adamantine stem is its stalk.
Its circumference extends to the Dharma realm.
Above it, he imagines a wonderful tower made of the treasures of the seven jewels.
It's adorned with the gods' wish-granting treasures.
Flowers, clouds, and incense scent the sea, and musicians sing their praises.

source_sentence: 於寶樓中師子座上淨滿月中。
translation: In the middle of the jeweled tower, on the lion's seat, there's a pure full moon.
There's a wonderful white lotus flower appearing.
He contemplates the [mu*han] letter gate.
It radiates a bright light that universally illuminates the Dharma realm.
It's the Tathāgata Mahāvairocana.
His body is shaped like a full moon.
He wears a crown of the five tathāgatas on his head.
He wears a veiled, celestial robe and a diadem to adorn his body.
His light shines brightly and universally.
There are measureless and incalculable crowds of great bodhisattvas.
They're surrounded by them in front and behind as their retinues.
The practitioner wants to cause all the tathāgatas to gather together.
They all assemble here.

source_sentence: 次以金剛王菩薩三摩地。
translation: Next, he uses the Vajrarāja bodhisattva samādhi.
It summons the sages.

source_sentence: 定慧二羽金剛拳　　交臂抱胸屈進力　彈指發聲遍世界　　諦觀佛海普雲集真言曰。
translation: He makes the adamantine fist with the two feathers of concentration and wisdom, crosses his arms, wraps his chest, flexes his muscles, snaps his fingers, and makes a sound that pervades the world. He observes the Buddha ocean and universally gathers clouds, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉(二)三麼惹(三)弱(四)　次結金剛鉤大印　　一切如來鉤召智　定慧和合外相叉　　進度如鉤獨三屈真言曰。
translation: "Om(1) mojarā(2) samajar(3) weak(4), then he forms the great seal of the vajra hook, which is the hooked, summoned wisdom of all tathāgatas, the combined external forks of concentration and wisdom, and the unique, three-fold bending of the hook that advances like a hook," he says.
"Om (1) āyagiri (2).

source_sentence: 次結金剛索大印　　引入尊身於智體　前印禪度入定掌　　力智相捻如環勢真言曰。
translation: Next, he sets the great seal of the vajra noose, which leads into the body of the honored one and places it in the body of wisdom. The previous seal meditates on entering into meditative concentration with the palms of his hands, and the force of wisdom is twisted like a ring, as the true saying goes.
"Om (1) Āyurveda, Un, Un (2).

source_sentence: 次結金剛鉤鎖印　　能令本尊堅固住　禪智進力相句結　　是名金剛能止印真言曰。
translation: "Next, he sets the sign of the vajra hook and chain, which causes the Bhagavān to stand firm and the advancing power of meditation and wisdom to be bound together in a phrase called the seal of the vajra that stops, which says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)係薩怖(二合)吒[牟*含]　次結金剛妙磬印　　能令諸聖皆歡喜　禪智屈入金剛縛　　是名金剛歡喜印真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) keśatha (2) za [mu*han], followed by the sign of the adamantine chime, will cause the sages to rejoice and the meditation wisdom to bend into the adamantine bonds. This is called the adamantine joy seal, which is called the true saying.
"Om (1) Kaṇṭhaka [mu*han].

source_sentence: 次入平等性智定　　捧持閼伽眾香水　想浴諸聖無垢身　　當得灌頂法雲地真言曰。
translation: "Next, he enters the concentration of the wisdom of equality, holding the perfumed water of the bodhisattvas, and contemplates bathing the bodies of the sages in the immaculate, which will then be consecrated with the true words, 'Dharma cloud ground.'

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折[口*路]娜誐吽(二)　次以金剛法歌詠　　讚揚如來諸福智　諦觀相好運清音　　以契如如真性理真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) mojar [ku*lu] nagar un (2) Next, he praises the Tathāgata's merit and wisdom with a song of the vajra teachings, observes the characteristics and performs clear sounds, and accords with the principle of the true nature of Tathāgata with the true words.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉(二)薩怛嚩(二合)僧蘖囉(二合)訶(三)麼折囉囉怛娜(二合四)麼努怛[口*藍](二合)(五)麼折囉達摩誐也柰(六)麼折囉羯麼(七)羯[口*路]婆嚩　次結金剛嬉戲印　　成就如來內眷屬　定慧和合金剛縛　　禪智二度當心竪真言曰。
translation: Om (1) mojarā (2) satanta (2) saṃtanā (2) ha (3) mojarā rātana (2) 4) manuḍṭa [mouth*ram] (2) (5) mojarā dharmagayāna (6) mojarā karmo (7) kar[mouth*road]vaipulya The next seal of the adamantine playfulness mudrā accomplishes the Tathāgata's inner circle of retinue, meditation, wisdom, and the rigid bondage of alloy, and the two liberations of meditation and wisdom are erected in the same mind, as the true saying goes.
"Om (1) mahalladi.

source_sentence: 由以嬉戲供養故　　不久當證金剛定　次結金剛花鬘印　　觀妙鬘雲普法界　不改前印捧而前　　想奉寶鬘用嚴首真言曰。
translation: Because of playful offerings, he'll soon realize adamantine concentration. Next, he sets the seal of the adamantine flower garland, observing the marvelous garland cloud that pervades the Dharma realm without changing his previous seal and holding it in front of him. He wants to present the jeweled garland with the true words of Yanshou, which are.
"Om (1) [muzzle*road] pośubha.

source_sentence: 由結金剛鬘供養　　當受灌頂法王位　次結金剛歌詠印　　以妙音聲讚佛智　前印從臍至口散　　演妙樂音娛聖會真言曰。
translation: "As a result of making offerings with the vajra garland, he'll be confirmed in the position of Dharma king. Next, he'll make the sign of the vajra song, praise the Buddha's wisdom with the sound of his wonderful voice. The preceding sign spreads from his navel to his mouth, and he pronounces the true words of the noble assembly for the entertainment of wonderful music: 'Om (1) Panicum (2) Tārā (2) Dry Creek.'

source_sentence: 唵(一)秫嚧(二合)怛囉(二合)燥溪　由以金剛歌供養　　不久當具如來辯　次結金剛舞妙印　　觀妙妓雲普供養　定慧當心各旋舞　　金剛合掌置頂上真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Paniculo (2) Tārā (2) Dṛghi. Because of this offering of the song of the vajras, he will soon become fully conversant with the Tathāgata's discernment. Next, he makes the sign of the vajra dance, which observes the marvelous clouds of prostitutes that are universally offered, and he sings and dances around with his mind focused on meditation and wisdom.
"Om (1) svabhūti (2).

source_sentence: 由以妙舞供養故　　當得如來意生身　次結焚香外供養　　以此普熏佛海會　和合金剛不散掌　　想妙香雲周法界真言曰。
translation: "Because of the offerings made through the marvelous dance, he will attain the body of the Tathāgata's mind-made body. Next, he makes an offering outside of the burning incense, using this to universally perfume the Buddha's ocean assembly, harmonize his palms with the alloy of the vajra, and not scatter them. He conceives a marvelous fragrant cloud that surrounds the Dharma realm, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢囉(二合)訶羅(二合)儞儞　由以焚香供養故　　即得如來無礙智　次結金剛散花印　　以北莊嚴諸世界　縛印上散如獻花　　芬馥花雲遍法界真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Prabhākaramitra (2) Hālā (2) Nenī, because of the offerings made with burning incense, you will attain the Tathāgata's unimpeded wisdom. Next, you should make the seal of the adamantine flower scatterer, which adorns the worlds to the north and scatters fragrant flowers like offerings above the binding seal.
"Om(1) phala gha mo(2).

source_sentence: 由結金剛花供養　　速證如來四八相　次以金剛燈明印　　普照佛會令光顯　禪智前逼金剛縛　　摩尼燈光照法界真言曰。
translation: "As a result of making offerings to the vajra flower, he quickly realizes the four times eight phases of the Tathāgata. Next, he uses the sign of the vajra lamp, which universally illuminates the Buddha's will and reveals his light. He forces the vajra bonds in front of his meditation wisdom, and the light of the maṇi lamp illuminates the Dharma realm with the true words.
"Om (1) Sudijaglauri (2).

source_sentence: 以此金剛燈供養　　速具如來淨五眼　次結金剛塗香印　　以用供養諸佛會　散金剛縛如塗香　　香氣周流十方界真言曰。
translation: "With this offering of the vajra lamp, he quickly perfects the Tathāgata's five pure eyes. Next, he sets the seal of the vajra-coated incense to be used in making offerings to the buddha assemblies, scattering the vajra-band like coated incense, and spreading the fragrance around the world in ten directions.
"Om (1) Su peak yangqiu (Yan'e).

source_sentence: 由以金剛塗香印　　得具五分法身智　如是廣作佛事已　　次應諦心為念誦　先當一緣觀本尊　　四明引入於己體　知身與尊無有二　　色相威儀皆與等　眾會眷屬自圍遶　　住於圓寂大鏡智　定慧二羽金剛縛　　忍願如刀進力附　先誦金剛百字明　　為令加持不傾動真言曰。
translation: After thus extensively performing the Buddha-works, you should then mindfully recite them with care. First, you should observe the Bhagavān in one condition, and then you should introduce the four illuminations into your own body, knowing that there is no difference between your body and the Bhagavān's form and appearance, and that they are all equal in appearance and demeanor. The congregation's retinue will surround you, abiding in the perfect tranquility of great mirror cognition, the two feathers of concentration and wisdom, the vajra binding, the forbearance and vow, like the advancing power of a sword. First, you should recite the vajra's 100-syllable mantra so that the support won't be tilted, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折囉薩怛縛(二合)三麼耶麼拏播攞耶(二)麼折囉薩怛嚩底尾(三)努播底瑟姹(四)涅里(二合)住(茶護反)弭婆嚩(五)素都使喻(二合下同)弭婆嚩(六)阿努[口*洛]訖都(二合)弭婆嚩(七)素補使喻弭婆嚩(八)薩婆悉地彌鉢囉(二合)也瑳(九)薩婆羯麼素遮弭(十)止多室利(二合)藥句嚧(十一)吽(十二)呵呵呵呵斛(引)(十三)薄伽梵薩婆怛他蘖多麼折囉麼寐悶遮(十四)麼折唎婆嚩(十五)摩訶三麼耶薩怛嚩(二合)(十六)惡(引)由以摩訶衍那百字真言加持故。
translation: 唵(一)麼折囉薩怛縛(二合)三麼耶麼拏播攞耶(二)麼折囉薩怛嚩底尾(三)努播底瑟姹(四)涅里(二合)住(茶護反)弭婆嚩(五)素都使喻(二合下同)弭婆嚩(六)阿努[口*洛]訖都(二合)弭婆嚩(七)素補使喻弭婆嚩(八)薩婆悉地彌鉢囉(二合)也瑳(九)薩婆羯麼素遮弭(十)止多室利(二合)藥句嚧(十一)吽(十二)呵呵呵呵斛(引)(十三)薄伽梵薩婆怛他蘖多麼折囉麼寐悶遮(十四)麼折唎婆嚩(十五)摩訶三麼耶薩怛嚩(二合)(十六)惡(引)由以摩訶衍那百字真言加持故。
Suppose someone commits one of the five heinous crimes.
They denigrate all the buddhas and the extensive sūtras.
He who cultivates the true language.
It's because the original [Buddha] firmly abides in himself.
He attains all the attainments sought in the present life.
It's called the supreme attainment.
It's the accomplishment of the Vajrasattva.
It's even the most excellent attainment of the Tathāgata.
He doesn't change his great seal of the vajradhātu.

source_sentence: 便誦本尊根本明真言曰。
translation: He then recites the true saying of the fundamental luminosity of the Bhagavān, which is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)麼折羅馱都(二)[牟*含]　定慧二羽捧珠鬘　　加本真言七遍已　捧至頂上復當心　　堅住等引而念誦　舌端微動脣齒合　　逆順循身觀相好　四時勤修不令間　　千百為限復過是　一切神通及福智　　現世同於遍照尊行者念誦分限畢已。
translation: "After saying this true chant seven times, he takes it to the top of his head and holds it firmly in his mind, recites it with equal guidance, moves his tongue slightly, closes his lips and teeth, follows the body in a reverse direction, and observes its appearance. He diligently cultivates it at four times without allowing it to be interrupted, and it's no longer limited to a thousand or more. He has the same abilities and good fortune and wisdom as the Venerable Prabhākaramitra in the present life.
He holds the pearl on his head.
He diligently makes the great vow.
He then makes the samādhi mudrā.
He enters the samādhi of the essential nature of the Dharma realm.
He cultivates the five-syllable whirling dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 諸法本不生　　自性離言說
translation: 'All dharmas are originally unarisen, and their own nature is free from language.'

source_sentence: 清淨無垢染　　因業等虛空
translation: pure and undefiled, such as space in terms of karma

source_sentence: 旋復諦思惟　　字字悟真實
translation: to reflect upon each word and realize its truth

source_sentence: 初後雖差別　　所證皆歸一
translation: although there are distinctions between the beginning and the end, all that is realized comes back to the same thing

source_sentence: 不捨是三昧　　兼住無緣悲
translation: samādhi of not abandoning and abiding in unconditional compassion

source_sentence: 普願諸有情　　如我無有異
translation: may all sentient beings behave as I do, without distinction
After emerging from samādhi, the practitioner then sets the fundamental mudrā.
He then sets the fundamental seal.

source_sentence: 誦本明七遍復以八大供養。
translation: He recites the original instructions seven times and then makes eight great offerings.
He makes offerings to the buddhas.
He praises and extols them with beautiful sounds and words.
He offers guardian water.
He uses the mudrā for subduing the three worlds.

source_sentence: 左旋解界即結金剛解脫印。
translation: Turning left to liberate the world, he then makes the sign of vajra liberation.
Sending the sages back to their native land, he sealed the previous samaya with the seal of acceptance of the vajra's liberation.

source_sentence: 印者結前三昧耶印忍願承華。
translation: The maker of the seal forms the previous samaya mudrā to bear the vows and receive the flowers.
He reaches the top and scatters it.
He says, in verbal form.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訖里(二合)姤嚩(入聲呼之)薩嚩薩怛嚩(二合)[口*栗]託(二合)(二)悉地捺多曳他努誐(引)(三)蘖瑳特鑁(二合)沒馱尾灑焰補娜囉(引)誐麼那(引)也都(四)唵麼折囉(二合)薩怛嚩(五二合)穆作是法已。
translation: "Om (1) keri (2) copula (call it by its incoming sound) sarva (2) sarva (2) [mouth*li] tuo (2) siddhi (2) nadta (3) tulip (2) buddha (2) buddha (2) buddha (3) buddha (2) buddha (3) buddha (3) buddha (3) buddha (4) buddha (4) om mahoraga (2) sarva (5) mu After making this dharma, he repeatedly applied the samaya mudrā.
He repeatedly used the samaya mudrā.
He recites the words of the blessing.
He uses the four parts of the seal.
He then consecrates his head.
He puts on his vajra armor.
He relies on the four previous salutations.
He pays homage to the buddhas of the four directions.
He confessed his sins and made his vows.
Then, he relies on a quiet place.
He decorates it with incense and flowers.
He abides in the original samādhi.
He recites the scriptures of the Mahāyāna in all directions.
He practices the sūtras as he wishes.

source_sentence: 若有眾生遇此教　　晝夜四時精進修　現世證得歡喜地　　後十六生成正覺金剛頂經瑜伽修習毘盧遮那三摩地法
translation: If sentient beings encounter this teaching and diligently cultivate it during the four hours of the day and night, they'll realize the joyous stage in the present life and then become truly enlightened in the next 16 lifetimes, cultivating the Vairocana samādhi method in the yoga of the Vajraśekhara-sūtra.
